metadata.title: CVE-2023-50782 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the python-cryptography package. This issue may allow aremote attacker to decrypt captured messages in TLS servers that use RSAkey exchanges, which may lead to exposure of confidential or sensitivedata.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-50782` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4+esm1
python3-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-cryptography package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4+esm1').
